headline.main: Times Minute | State of Play in Ukraine
headline.kicker: The New York Times News Minute

docs.snippet: Andrew Roth reports from Eastern Ukraine and David Herszenhorn reports from Moscow as Ukraine looks for an end to the standoff between Russia and the West....
docs.abstract: Andrew Roth reports from Eastern Ukraine and David Herszenhorn reports from Moscow as Ukraine looks for an end to the standoff between Russia and the West.

headline.print_headline: Boehner Comments on Immigration Draw Fire
headline.main: Boehner Comments on Immigration Draw Fire

docs.snippet: House Speaker John Boehner drew criticism from left and right Friday over comments mocking his own Republican lawmakers for their reluctance to take up immigration legislation, rekindling election-year debate on the contentious issue even as Presi...
docs.lead_paragraph: House Speaker John Boehner drew criticism from left and right Friday over comments mocking his own Republican lawmakers for their reluctance to take up immigration legislation, rekindling election-year debate on the contentious issue even as President Barack Obama weighs acting on his own.

headline.print_headline: South Sudan Facing US Sanctions During Kerry Trip
headline.main: South Sudan Facing US Sanctions During Kerry Trip

docs.snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry will renew his threat of sanctions against militants in a visit next week to South Sudan, where ethnic killings are ripping apart the 3-year-old nation and all but scuttling peace talks....
docs.lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry will renew his threat of sanctions against militants in a visit next week to South Sudan, where ethnic killings are ripping apart the 3-year-old nation and all but scuttling peace talks.

docs.snippet: Oilfield services company Baker Hughes Inc. says the number of rigs exploring for oil and natural gas in the U.S. rose by 30 this week to 1,861....
docs.lead_paragraph: Oilfield services company Baker Hughes Inc. says the number of rigs exploring for oil and natural gas in the U.S. rose by 30 this week to 1,861.

headline.print_headline: Former NFL Quarterback Earl Morrall Dies at 79
headline.main: Former NFL Quarterback Earl Morrall Dies at 79

docs.snippet: Earl Morrall stepped in when the 1972 Miami Dolphins needed him most. And then he willingly stepped aside, earning enduring admiration from his teammates and coach Don Shula....
docs.lead_paragraph: Earl Morrall stepped in when the 1972 Miami Dolphins needed him most. And then he willingly stepped aside, earning enduring admiration from his teammates and coach Don Shula.

headline.print_headline: Italy Rescues 1,800 More Migrants From Boats in Rough Seas
headline.main: Italy Rescues 1,800 More Migrants From Boats in Rough Seas

docs.snippet: Italian navy and coastguard vessels have rescued around 1,800 more people from boats in rough seas off Sicily, authorities said on Friday, as the chronic migrant crisis continued around the southern island....
docs.lead_paragraph: Italian navy and coastguard vessels have rescued around 1,800 more people from boats in rough seas off Sicily, authorities said on Friday, as the chronic migrant crisis continued around the southern island.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Money Manager Pleads Guilty in Long-Running Fraud Case
headline.main: U.S. Money Manager Pleads Guilty in Long-Running Fraud Case

docs.snippet: More than five years after his indictment, a U.S. money manager and one-time part owner of the New York Islanders hockey team pleaded guilty Friday to engaging in a massive securities fraud....
docs.lead_paragraph: More than five years after his indictment, a U.S. money manager and one-time part owner of the New York Islanders hockey team pleaded guilty Friday to engaging in a massive securities fraud.

headline.print_headline: Greece: 14 Protests Per Day Since Bailout
headline.main: Greece: 14 Protests Per Day Since Bailout

docs.snippet: Greece's Public Order Ministry says it has policed an average of 14 protests per day since the country's bailout four years ago, and defended its frequent use of tear gas at violent street rallies....
docs.lead_paragraph: Greece's Public Order Ministry says it has policed an average of 14 protests per day since the country's bailout four years ago, and defended its frequent use of tear gas at violent street rallies.

headline.print_headline: New Jersey Lawmakers Subpoenaed on Bridge Probe
headline.main: New Jersey Lawmakers Subpoenaed on Bridge Probe

docs.snippet: New Jersey lawmakers investigating the traffic jams at the heart of the scandal engulfing Gov. Chris Christie say federal prosecutors have ordered them to share documents they have gathered....
docs.lead_paragraph: New Jersey lawmakers investigating the traffic jams at the heart of the scandal engulfing Gov. Chris Christie say federal prosecutors have ordered them to share documents they have gathered.
